channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Kennedy Center to close for 2 years for construction in July, Trump says
item.description: President Trump says he will move to close Washington's Kennedy Center for two years. It follows a wave of cancellations since Trump ousted the previous leadership and added his name to the building.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump says he will move to close Washington's Kennedy Center for two years. It follows a wave of cancellations since Trump ousted the previous leadership and added his name to the building.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: What to know about Artemis II's 'wet dress rehearsal'
item.description: As astronauts prepare to fly around the moon, critical testing must occur before there is "Go" for launch.
item.content:encoded:
As astronauts prepare to fly around the moon, critical testing must occur before there is "Go" for launch.

(Image credit: Miguel J. Rodriguez Carrillo)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Bomb cyclone brings bitter cold and snow to the Southeast
item.description: Temperatures in southern Florida reached the coldest they've been since 1989, according to the National Weather Service.
item.content:encoded:
Temperatures in southern Florida reached the coldest they've been since 1989, according to the National Weather Service.

(Image credit: Sean Rayford)
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Tense negotiations in Washington to end partial government shutdown
item.description: House Speaker Mike Johnson predicts the partial shutdown will be over by Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: House Speaker Mike Johnson predicts the partial shutdown will be over by Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Minnesota woman says local police freed her from immigration agents' custody
item.description: A Minnesota woman says that after she filmed immigration agents, the officers chased her, detained her at gunpoint, and later dropped her off with local police.
item.content:encoded: A Minnesota woman says that after she filmed immigration agents, the officers chased her, detained her at gunpoint, and later dropped her off with local police.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Yang

item.title: Population growth is slowing, and the ripple effects could be wide
item.description: Immigration crackdowns may be slowing U.S. population growth and reshaping the economy, says Luke Pardue, policy director at the Aspen Institute Economic Strategy Group.
item.content:encoded: Immigration crackdowns may be slowing U.S. population growth and reshaping the economy, says Luke Pardue, policy director at the Aspen Institute Economic Strategy Group.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: Faith leaders in Memphis join together to support Afghan refugees
item.description: Two Memphis pastors, Stephen Cook and Latif Salar, are working to protect Afghan church members after the Trump administration halted asylum processing.
item.content:encoded: Two Memphis pastors, Stephen Cook and Latif Salar, are working to protect Afghan church members after the Trump administration halted asylum processing.
item.dc:creator: Kathryn Fink

item.title: Would you give up a freshly-dug parking space? The ethics of spot-saving in the winter
item.description: Your car was buried under the snow, you spent hours digging it out: Are you now going to give up your parking spot without a fight? Not in Baltimore you won't.
item.content:encoded: Your car was buried under the snow, you spent hours digging it out: Are you now going to give up your parking spot without a fight? Not in Baltimore you won't.
item.dc:creator: Scott Maucione

item.title: Minnesota citizens detained by ICE are left rattled, even weeks later
item.description: The number of immigration agents in Minnesota may be reduced, but they'll leave leave behind a changed community, including many U.S. citizens questioned and detained in recent weeks.
item.content:encoded:
The number of immigration agents in Minnesota may be reduced, but they'll leave leave behind a changed community, including many U.S. citizens questioned and detained in recent weeks.

(Image credit: Adam Gray/AP)
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: Democrat Taylor Rehmet wins a reliably Republican Texas state Senate seat, stunning GOP
item.description: Democrat Taylor Rehmet won a special election for the Texas state Senate on Saturday, flipping a reliably Republican district that President Donald Trump won by 17 points in 2024.
item.content:encoded:
Democrat Taylor Rehmet won a special election for the Texas state Senate on Saturday, flipping a reliably Republican district that President Donald Trump won by 17 points in 2024.

(Image credit: Eric Gay)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
